pageContext.claim: “We have turned away, at great expense, two major Caravans, but a big one has now formed and is coming. At least 8000 people! If we had a powerful Wall, they wouldn't even try to make the long and dangerous journey. Build the Wall and Crime will Fall!”
pageContext.analysis: There is no evidence that a wall would prevent people from seeking asylum in the United States, especially since the wall would not always come up to the border, allowing someone to make a claim. Trump insinuates that illegal immigration breeds crime, but most independent research contradicts the idea that illegal immigrants bring more crime.
